description:
Great prices (less than $9 bucks for an entree Pad See Ew)!!!! I will definitely try it again. I got chicken pad see ew, the flavors were great, there was a lot of chicken, and it was only $8.95! Unheard of in SF!!!

Definitely will come back to this place again (I got a take out order!).
author: Hanna M.

description:
Not bad, but not amazing.  I've been wanting to try this place because of the name.  However, the food is not spicy at all (they didn't even ask for a spice level).  

We tried their:

* Tom Yum Soup (good)
* Fried Chicken Wings (good, a bit too sweet)
* Beef Pad Thai (there was too much sauce for my taste and the beef was overcooked)
* Triple Flavor Fish (not bad)

Overall, the food was good.  What we enjoyed about this place was how quiet it was in the restaurant.
author: Sandy H.

description:
This place is shady. They automatically charged for tip but when paying with credit card they didn't provide the original bill afterwards so it's easy to overlook the fact that they had already charged you ... so you end up paying them double for tip. The gratuity font is also super tiny right above the total not next to tax so there's no doubt that they're doing this on purpose. Service was also not great, they came by once to get our order and another to deliver the food. Then later on just casually slipped the bill onto our table without a word.  

Duck fried rice was great. Curry was too sweet and Tom yum soup was too salty. FYI curry doesn't come with rice and is an extra $2 charge. Would not come back here again because of the way they operate.
author: Ashley W.

description: I want to give it 5 based purely on the Roasted Duck Noodle Soup. This broth has healing powers. There are many other places that serve this soup,  but no other broth compares in my eyes.  I lived near this place for a long time, and they stayed true during the name change. When I visit home again, this is on the top of my list of must gets!!! Other items are well done and I am never disappointed.
author: Beth M.

description:
Thai is my favorite cuisine and I've been to many Thai restaurants in the Bay Area and have become a bit particular about my Thai food, so forgive me for possibly being a bit picky here.  And with that being said...

This is definitely not a 5-star place, although it is good.  The interior is part calming (good), part funky (not so good).  Chicken Satay was fine, peanut sauce great but chicken could have been cut and cooked a bit better.  Tom Kha Khai soup was creamy, and tofu inside was not fried but nice and soft, which is good, but just not the ultimate flavor-wise.  

I'm a huge fan of Massaman (or Mussamun) Curry, a special Southern Thai dish which, if done right, is cooked for 24 hours and uses stew beef chunks.  They have this curry here, which initially drew me in, but it's not the beef stew kind, just one of their several curries that you choose a meat to go with, which is not traditional.  So I knew this wouldn't be my regular fave, but I decided to try it.  Unfortunately, it was just 'ok.'   Definitely not the Massaman I'm used to.  Hard to even describe the flavor -- peanut mixed with some other spice I can't put my finger on.

Yah, I'm definitely a bit picky, the food here is fine.  You'll have a decent meal.  But, for me, it doesn't come close to my go-to, Chili Cha Cha 2 in the Mission.
author: Merrick W.

description:
Pad see ew, pretty mediocre, nothing too special, but better then other places.
Spicy (angel) wings, more on the sweet side, tasted like Korean friend chicken to me, pretty good. 
Tom yum soup was really delicious! The best thing so far. Right amount of heat and sour, but the chicken in it was kind of a let down. It was really dry, I would opt for another protein next time.
author: Yeah O.

description:
Cheaper than Marnee Thai, tasted good. Only been here once, service isn't the best. But then again no one was there in the restaurant besides me. I see most people ordered To Go here. 

Will come back to try other dishes.
author: Debbie D.

description:
After my nephew's graduation, we headed for his favorite Japanese restaurant. Since they don't take reservations, it was a 45 minute wait at around 8:00 pm. So, we opted for Sriracha his favorite Thai restaurant in the Inner Sunset area and were seated immediately as it was only half full.
 
My sister, who frequents Sirarcha, suggested some of her favorite dishes.  Needing another item, I was tasked with selecting an entrée.  Our dishes:
 
Pad Se-Ew Shrimp - stirred fried rice noodle with shrimp and sweet soy sauce., Chinese broccoli, broccoli, carrot and egg.  Tasty with a slightly sweet flavor.
 
Pineapple fried rice with prawns, pineapple, egg, raisin, pea-carrot, onion and cashews. Rice had a good texture and dish had four good size prawns. 
 
Sriracha fried rice with egg, chili, hot basil, onion, topped with grilled prawns and fried egg.  This dish was flavorful, but it does have a kick to it, especially to those that have a light tolerance to spice.
 
Kanah moo krob - stir fried roasted pork belly with Chinese broccoli, spicy chili garlic and black bean
Sauce - More of a Chinese stir fried dish with Chinese roast pork. Good, but didn't seem like a Thai dish.  Also, black bean sauce was light in black beans.
 
Grilled chicken with Thai herbs, with sweet and sauce and fresh green salad.  My order, which my sister has not tried. It was grilled chicken breast that was a little on the dry side.  Probably my least favorite of our dishes.
 
Fried banana with coconut ice cream. Two egg rolls filled with bananas and a scoop of coconut ice cream.  Creamy ice cream, but I have had better deep-fried bananas.
 
Fresh mango with sweet sticky rice - first time trying this dessert. It consisted of slices of fresh mango with a large scoop of sweet rice.
 
Overall, very good Thai cuisine in good size portions with efficient friendly service. Nice option for Thai in the Inner Sunset.
author: Al L.

description:
I could tell from the aroma wafting from the kitchen as soon as I walked in that I was going to have a phenomenal experience here.  It drew me in like the pied piper.

I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with chicken for only $8.95.  The flavors blended perfectly and the chicken, while very lean and only white meat, could have turned out way too dry but was cooked just right so that it was not.  It had a twinge of spicy that wasn't too strong for my Caucasian taste buds, but left a nice afterburn lingering in my mouth.  It wasn't too salty or too oily, there wasn't too much gravy drowning out the noodles, and they didn't skimp on meat and vegetables and give mostly noodles the way some places do.  

They also have a nice wine selection, and a decor that looks both classy yet ethereal at the same time.  

I'm also intrigued that they have vegetarian samosas here.  Usually I cannot eat samosas as they are usually made with wheat-flour and I am allergic to gluten.  However, these ones are made with rice flour.  So I think that next time when I am with a bigger group, I will try those.

One of my favorite Thai dishes in general is either the Tom Yum or the Tom Kha soup.  What I really appreciate about this place is that you can order a small cup of soup as an add-on to your meal, and you don't have to automatically buy a large portion for about $9-10 if your friends don't all want to split it with you.  I also appreciate how their menu is laid out, so that you can decide if you want a dish that is focused around noodles, stir-fried meat, or curry, etc.

Overall, I highly recommend this place.  For a reasonably-priced place that isn't super expensive or high-end, the food is very tasty.
author: Sarah R.

description:
I came to Sriracha Thai for a dinner date with my cousin, on the recommendation of my other cousin. The cousin that recommended Sriracha Thai said that this restaurant had the most authentic tasting khao soi (coconut curry noodle dish) that she's had since she was in Thailand a couple years ago!! After trying it, even though we had nothing to compare it to because neither of us have been to Thailand, we agreed it was one of the best noodle dishes we've had. It had a creamy coconut curry sauce and lots of crunchies! 

Along with the khao soi, we ordered red curry with chicken, the spicy chicken wings, and a bowl of rice. The red curry with chicken was verrry similar to the khao soi, but we weren't mad at it! It had more veggies and was more liquidy than the khao soi. It was really yummy over rice! The spicy chicken wings are far from spicy, but still good. The sauce is reminiscent of sweet chili sauce, and I loved that it was topped with fried basil. 

Service was very friendly and the price point was pretty reasonable. I'll for sure be back to get some khao soi!
author: Tara A.

description:
Came here for lunch & ordered from the lunch specials menu.

Ordered the Pad Kee Mao with Chicken & Fried Rice with Beef. No complaints about anything we ordered. Really enjoyed the free soup they give you for your lunch special because it had a hint of sourness & tofu bits!

Only thing I found strange was when I asked for Sriracha, but was brought the usual Thai restaurant toppings with regular chili sauce instead. The restaurant is called Sriracha... would have expected it to be more readily available. Was successful with my second attempt for Sriracha, so I was happy.

Wouldn't hesitate coming back here if I was in the area for Thai food.
author: Carol N.

description:
First timer. Food is really nice and tasteful. Ambiance is good too. I would definitely come back here.
I came with my fiends here and we ordered pad ki mau, panang Curry, Tom kha soup and spring roll. We ordered everything vegetarian.
I can recommend this place for vegetarians.
author: Kavya I.

description:
The bill before anything !! 
I'm Thai food lover I'm just far from my favorite place so I decide to give this place a shot since I was close first I called to check if they have halal meet and they didn't understand what I'm saying! After two people the boss I think he talked and said yes I went to the place I didn't find any sign says halal and saw beer butlers everywhere so I decide to just get sea food and not trusting them however I got pad Thai sea food and she just asks me to pay I was like do I have to pay now !! She was like yes ! I was surprised because I'm not at taco bell lol I just walked in restaurant no welcomes pay first in the end they bring my food In plastic box !!! I was like I'm going to eat here i didn't order to go and she just gave it to me in the plastic she didn't at least try to put it in plate or something long story short NO WELCOMING , PAY BEFORE YOU EAT , RUDE AND FOOD WAS OK NOT AS EXPECTED FIRST AND LAST TIME HERE
author: Daniel L.

description:
I used to come here for lunch. They have a lunch special that comes with soup, rice or pad Thai, side of protein and appetizer. Most of the time I order their crab fried rice and a Thai Iced Tea. However, I do have to knock one star off due to the fact that halfway through my crab fried rice, I turned over a cucumber slice, and found a bug stuck to it. That turned me off big time! Nobody wants to eat bug fried rice. 

Sriracha is also the place that the stranger next to me paid for my meal and left! What a nice deed and I will be forever grateful to his kind heart. It was unexpected when I finished and asked for my bill only to find out the man next to me paid already. I was so in shocked! So thank you and kind things do happen!
author: Annie L.

description:
After a long drive from LA into the city, hunger pangs struck. We were supposed to hit the museum, but I got a glimpse of the name Sriracha. I'm picky about Thai food, so I opened my trusty Yelp and the food pictures drew me in.  For trying out a new Thai place, this exceeded my expectations.

Clean, open layout. Very friendly people working here.  The food is as clean and flavorful as I had hoped. We ordered the need pad Kee mao, garlic and pepper tofu rice plate, the fried pork and Chinese broccoli specialty dish, and beef stew noodle soup. My daughter was not hungry when we sat down, but she ate the entire order of tofu.  It's like THAT.  I normally only order one item, but I wanted noodles and the pork and broccoli looked good. I thoroughly expected to bring noodles back to the hotel for a late night snack.... No food was left on the table.  None.
author: Jamee H.

description:
Just came here last week again after many months and it didn't disappoint.

First try of Thai food for my parents and they loved it. 

Among 4 of us we shared:

- fresh shrimp spring rolls
- fried calamari
- shrimp pad thai
- veg egg fried rice
- grilled pork (garlic marination)
- red chicken curry

Everything was delicious and light. Clean place and friendly service. It always brings me back to Thailand.
author: Heliana M.

description: We order pineapple fried rice and pad Thai. It was okay. I e had better before. The fried rice was a bit bland and the pad Thai seems like they just used sauce from the bottle. I wouldn't go back.
author: NkaujLig Y.

description:
-For what you pay: Portions were okay, felt needy of rice. Typically leave a curry place turgid and tumescent. 
-Ambiance: Not very appeasing.  Boring and bland is best way to put it
-Service: Very Good
-Taste: Satisfying

It had been a while since my wife and I had Thai curry.  We always went to the chain restaurant in Atlanta known as Top Spice.  

The feeling of inauthenticity given from this place's veneer is possibly derived from a seemingly besmeared tarnish of an old sports bar.  Perhaps this diminished the ambiance for me.  I noticed the waiting staff openly talking across the bar and hanging out prior to spotting us and sitting us.  Despite this, the service was impeccable and they were very kind.  My wife and I both got the massaman chicken.   A curry chicken with largely diced potatoes, carrots and green peppers.  It was satisfying but I have had better.  I was hoping for something better than our go-to chain restaurant. 

Street parking.
author: Rob C.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant after visiting Golden Gate Park, and so glad I did! The pad see ew was a good portion, with a lot of meat and vegetables (way more than other restaurants of the same price range), and very tasty! At a great price!
author: Alice Z.

description:
If you're going to eat food from here, go in person. Period.

I've been to sit down and eat and the food is good and tasty and pretty much what I'm exactly looking for.

Do not, under any circumstances, order deliver online from this place. $20 minimum? I can deal with that. I like me some chicken wings and some fried rice and some extra sticky rice just so I can hit the minimum of $20 before tax to get it delivered.

Then, an hour and a half later my food still wasn't here. A mere 0.8 miles away. And then they couldn't track my order. And just assured me it was on it's way.

Then I asked for a charge back and said, "fuck this, it's too late for me to even eat at this point." To which I was told, your food should almost be there.

Then I said, okay, fuck it, I don't give a fuck, take my money and fuck it, I don't need to eat.

My food, interestingly enough, did show up. My fried rice showed up. Cool. My sticky rice, which as a reminder I only ordered to hit the $20 minimum, showed up. My wings? Cubed tofu.

Fuck ordering form this place. I'm not mad at any of the people that work there. I'm mad at the people that manage the place. You can't track your orders? Rice and wings take an hour and a half to get just over a half mile? GTFO. 

And when I asked for at least a partial charge back to my card the woman I was speaking with suddenly didn't understand english. This is bullshit and I'm only eating it because it I weren't, I'd be considering cutting up my dog and eating her instead. It might take only a little bit longer.

I'm only giving it two stars because the food is halfway decent.
author: Coe S.

description: I live nearby and this is my go-to Thai spot. Very reasonable prices for quality food.
author: Golan S.

description: The khao soi is off the hook, just as good as the kind I ate in Chaing Mai. I dont think its on the menu but its incrediable. Every other dish was also perfection.
author: Monica D.

description:
I can never be wrong with Thai Restaurant .. 

Tried the appetizer Gyoza with curry pesto sauce .. something different but it's a good 

Their siracha fried rice hit it on the spot I sweat but this is soooo good .. my thai friend can smell the fried rice . Nice aromatic.. with the green curry fish !!! Plus add spicy fish sauce..( you need to request this sauce ) another feather on thai place..

I'll be back and get this combo..

Siracha Fried Rice
Green Curry Fish
( request the chili Fish sauce) pour a drop to your fried rice ..

It's like eating back in Thailand  

Khup
author: Donovan L.

description: TBH, I think king of Thai is better. Ordered delivery from them on a Monday night, and everything came quickly and the order was right, but everything I ordered "spicy" wasn't spicy at alI. Wish things actually had a kick. Had a bowl of Tom yum, pad see ew, and green curry. Everything here was on the sweeter side, even the Tom yum. Also found a long pube in my pad see ew which kind of ruined it for me
author: Sandy K.

description:
As previously indicated, when in the avenues, I will only venture out to Sunset for food, you'd never ever find me on Clement or Geary, of course I'd still eat take outs if friend ordered them for me and have them delivered to me. It's that level of commitment that got me exploring Sunset in the form of Thai restaurants. My colleague had told me about this joint, knowing that I like to eat. He said that the food was decent and it was not expensive. He would be right. The soup is very light and healthy. The papaya salad with shrimp is incredibly tasty. The fish is the highlight, with so many variations, though the snapper fillet was my favorite, spicy and sour, and a little sweet to boot.

The TV is on so that you can watch a game if you are so inclined. My favorite neighborhood spot in the avenues for Thai is still Thai Time but I can't go because it's close to Clement street. As such I try my very best to look for replacement and this is absolutely a close second. Plus their seafood dishes are total winners.

Glad that's it's not too busy. Never have to wait. A bonus when you are tired and need to be fed right away after work.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Ordered a delivery and love it. Great size portions, well seasoned, fresh ingredients.

The only reason it gets only 4 starts is because of the deep fried and yet mushy tofu.

If you like spicy order more than mild I'll do next time. 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND
author: Eleonora B.

description:
Delicious food friendly and fast service 
fried rice and crispy chicken and Pad we we will be back for sure!
author: Teresa H.

description: Seriously amazing place! Great service. Food came to the table quick. The cuisine was very flavorful, & had awesome presentation. Generous portions of food for every order. Definitely going to come back.
author: Sabina P.

description:
I have been here for both dine-in and takeout. Although their lunch specials are a great value, and the service is always friendly, their food always leaves me less than satisfied. I visited first a year ago for their lunch and looooved their yellow curry lunch special, which came with soup, rice and a dessert. Recently though, I ordered Pad See Ew and although the flavor was delicious and the noodles were tender, the tofu in my dish tasted just like cardboard. Overcooked, dry. No seasoning. It was terribly disappointing.

Maybe this just isn't the place to get pad see ew when my cravings are strong. Overall though, a decent place to grab a bite.
author: Anna P.

description:
Service: Ordered here using grubhub and it was ready as soon as we arrived. 

Food: The portions were really solid. We ordered pad thai and basil chicken for two people and were not able to finish the dishes. 

Prices: For the amount and for being located in SF, I'd definitely recommend!
author: Brianne I.

description:
This is an expensive thai restaurant for the crappy service and mediocre food. 

We ordered the "special" siracha, which was just regular thai fried rice. 
The shrimp was NOT deveined and burnt.
Food came extremely late and got no apologies. 

It was $50 for 2 people in a small janky thai restaurant. no thanks
author: Jesse J.

description: 80. Shrimp pad thai is delicious! Served warm...perfect for cold weather. My absolute favorite...can't go wrong with this plate!
author: Juan V.

description:
Ordered for pick up. 
~10mins

Pad Kee Mao w/Chicken Spicy - was not spicy, a little on the oily side, more on the sweet side. Chicken had good flavor. . 

Tom Kha w/chicken & mushrooms - lacking sour flavor. Coconut milk was smooth, good balance. Chicken was tad dry. 
Total lunch: $14.69

I might return to try the green curry but I probably will not order again.
author: PreciousSwt P.

description:
Dinner was fantastic here!

We wandered in here and were really impressed. The service is extremely fast and the food is really good and seems to be on the healthier end of the spectrum of Thai food.

Ordered the fresh spring rolls which came with this awesome sauce on top. Also ordered the yellow curry chicken with some rice.

Left feeling full and paying an affordable amount. Will return soon!
author: James D.

description:
Considering the whole point of Yelp, this may sound pretty idiotic.  However, sometimes I think I should only try places that don't have a ton of praise behind them.  That way, I don't have to worry about being disappointed by the experience!  As well as not having to feel like a pariah for offering one of the few dissenting voices.  More than 50% are five star reviews?  Really?

Although the name may be new, Sriracha Thai looks quite similar to its predecessor, Soi Gow Cafe.  Not only is the staff/management seemingly the same, but the menu looks familiar as well (with the exception of a few dishes here and there).  Which, in total, makes all of these sparkling reviews kind of surprising; under their old name, they only had a three and a half star average!  Then again, it did make them that much more intriguing...

-- (#6) SPICY CHICKEN WINGS - Deep Fried Chicken Wings topped with Chili Garlic and Crispy Basil...$7.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sriracha-thai-cuisine-san-francisco?select=Faqn9IysrFsMVQIKT77PJg)
Probably the best thing we had, though there are better Angel Wings out there.  I liked how the batter wasn't too heavy and how juicy the chicken was.  However, while the overall flavor of the sauce was fine (not overly sweet), it really could have used a bit more heat.

-- (#1) SPRING ROLL with Pork - Deep Fried Egg Rolls stuffed with Silver Noodles, Taro, and Vegetables, served with Sweet & Sour Sauce and Ground Peanuts...$6.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sriracha-thai-cuisine-san-francisco?select=3MO451RAME1ra1QLmxo24Q)
Not really flawed, but not really memorable either.  The rolls were fried up to a perfect golden brown, weren't very oily, and had a nice amount of filling.  That said, the rolls weren't super flavorful on their own and I didn't care much for the dipping sauce (my friend liked it though).  

-- (#81) PAD SEE EW with Chicken - Stir-fried Small Rice Noodles with Sweet Soy Sauce, Broccoli, and Eggs...$8.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sriracha-thai-cuisine-san-francisco?select=BeiJmFI_xoXhZ1h53V3bFw)
Not spectacular, but pretty solid all around.  The portion was decently generous and I liked how they didn't skimp on the goodies.  Plus, the noodles had a great, chewy texture to them.  I think they could have gone a little lighter on the sweet soy sauce, but not a big deal.

-- (#60) PAD GRA PROW with Beef - Sauteed with Spicy Garlic Sauce, Sweet Basil, Bell Pepper, and Vegetables...$9.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sriracha-thai-cuisine-san-francisco?select=8Ng12PI2rTnq6pJh--eIDg)
My least favorite dish, though due, in part, to my friend's choice of beef over chicken or pork. (either would've worked better).  It also would've helped if the sauce stuck to the meat better.  Still, there's no denying there was a good amount of beef that was quite tender.  

-- (#92) KANAH MOO KROB - Sauteed Crispy Roasted Pork Belly with Chinese Broccoli, Spicy Chili Garlic, and Black Bean Sauce...$12.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sriracha-thai-cuisine-san-francisco?select=bv2YbQJ-xXCiWbAPpWTYMA)
A bit disappointing, to be honest.  Though it tasted fine (more salty than spicy), the dish was light on pork belly (it was the best part!).  What's more, it was made even more apparent by the dish's overwhelming amount of broccoli (side note - there were A LOT of stalks).

While the food certainly didn't overwhelm us, there really wasn't anything "bad" about it.  Plus, given the lack of crowds here, it's certainly a spot worth considering for something quick in a pinch or for some take-out (if you happen to be here already, as parking around here can be a pain).  I just can't get on board with most of these reviews.  Not when there are (relatively nearby) alternatives like Amphawa or Marnee Thai down the street that are better.
author: Mike L.

description: It's my first time to eat dine-in in this place with my kids yesterday, and the food was good. I got grilled salmon, my kids got grilled pork and I also got a caramari and it was soooo good. The kids loved the food they say it's delicious ! And today I ordered some for my boyfriend coz he likes Thai food too so I hope he likes the food as I do!
author: Jeramie F.

description: Couldn't find any other place that was Asian which was open today on CNY but then we saw this place. I always remember walking past this place going to school back then and I thought the name of it was so weirdly attracting. Sriracha. I'm personally not a fan of Sriracha myself but this place was pretty good. Although I'm not sure how sriracha comes into play in the food, still worthwhile to come here. The waitress was super friendly. We ended up eating a duck noodle soup, fried rice with crispy chicken and a satay chicken. I loved the fried rice. It reminded me of my childhood fried rice. The cripsy chicken was delish although I wish there were more meat. The sweet and sour sauce was divine. Portion size was small but it's enough to fill a medium eater like me. My experience here was quite pleasant although it was by chance. I would recommend and take people her in the future!
author: Bernice L.

description: I love their Thai coffee ice tea and the pad-see-ew. I had green curry but I didn't like it, its white color with a taste of lots of coconut syrup in it. I thought it's gonna be a green color green curry dish but this one is different...
author: Monique Q.

description: Eaten here a number of times. They have a pesto pot sticker dish that i really like. Las week, i was doing some home repair and a bit frumpy. Ordered my usual.dishes .  From the time the food arrived the server was trying to rush me. Like i said, been there many times, but this time.they just relentlessly tried to rush me out. There was maybe 4 other customers.  That will be my last visit
author: Lamb C.

description: Consistently very good Thai food every time I've ordered from here so far.  Asking for "medium" spicy is also very consistent too (good heat, but don't feel like I am going to die).
author: Daniel Q.

description:
Decided to try this new Thai place on Irving and was a little disappointed since it seemed to have been getting good ratings. We ordered a variety of fried appetizers which were mediocre -- nothing exactly special. The wonton wrapped around the shrimp and egg rolls were pretty good though, not too greasy. 

I got the pad Kee Mao which was pretty good. Not too much chicken, but the flavor was pretty good. 

The others in my group had other dishes that were more disappointing. :/ there was the rad na (thick noodles on gravy) -- thought the gravy could be a little thicker and there could definitely be a little more portion-wise. The specialty entree (forget the exact name) came with a green curry, overcooked vermicelli noodles, and some small pieces of salmon on the side. 

The overall atmosphere of the place was nice -- serene background music, normal voice levels, decent seating and spacing. Would maybe come back if I was craving thai food and didn't know of any other places around the neighborhood.
author: Meagan C.

description:
Horrible delivery and costumer service! Dried food on their plate when I dined in. 

Ordered a sauté dish, but waited for 1 hour before it was delivered, even though driving should only take 1 min.. Food was completely cold. Deliver woman rude: showed the receipt, took away the money and tip without any word or thanks. No manner at all.

Lied to yelp about my order time. They claimed I ordered the food after the restaurant's closing time.  Which didn't make sense because I ordered ~8:50pm. Didn't get delivered until  ~9:57pm .Plus, why would they deliver if I really ordered after their hours?

Food was alright but really horrible services!!
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
Really liked the food, but portions were on the smaller side. We ordered the Steamed Mussels (Appetizer), Grilled Chicken (Grilled), Pad Cha Talay (Sauteed), and Pad Geang Keaw Wan Pla Gry (Chef Special).

Steamed Mussels: Actually very good! There was no salty, seafood taste whatsoever! The dish included about 8 mussels and a simple dipping sauce. Very clean and light.

Grilled Chicken: Very tender chicken! Loved it! It came with a sweet and sour sauce and also a side salad (lettuce, tomatoes, and some ranch sauce)

Pad Cha Talay: Delicious, but the portion was rather small. There was a lot of red curry sauce though, which was sweet and not very spicy.

Pad Geang Keaw Wan Pla Gry: Contrary to the Pad Cha Talay, the portion was a lot bigger (maybe because it is a Chef's Special). The green curry sauce was a lot spicier than the red curry sauce, but it was tolerable.
author: Celena C.

description: I've really been getting into Thai food lately so when I was looking up places in San Francisco, I came across Sriracha and decided to try it out. There was nobody in there besides the workers at the time I went, but it didn't bother me so the atmosphere was nice and mellow. It also kind of made sense to me because it was in the middle of the day on a Monday. I ordered the seafood noodle soup, and it was amazing!!! Most of the places that I've been to that has noodle soups, the portions are always so huge that sometimes I can't always finish and I would hate to have to end up getting the huge soup to-go. The sizes that they have here are just perfect, so easy to finish. They have so many options on the menu and most of the entrees are under $10! If I ever crave Thai food, I'm definitely going to this place again.
author: Kanella G.

description: I really enjoyed everything I've tried from here, pad see ew with beef, Tom yum soup, and chicken satay. Minus one star because I ordered TO GO and they forgot the peanut sauce for the satay.
author: Jaye B.

description: So yummy! Awesome neighborhood spot. Would recommend as one of my favorite inner sunset Thai restaurants.
author: Kelsey D.

description:
The service here was great. The waiter immediately sat us, the drinks came right away and he gave us just enough time to glance over the menu before tending to us. 

The food was delicious. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken or something with chicken fried rice. 

DELICIOUS. 

I took half home and had it later. 

The atmosphere was chill, and everyone said bye when we left. I would definitely come back again.
author: Carmen C.

description: Good food and good service. I like the deep fried spring rolls. Also ordered roasted duck five spiced noodle soup. It's the best one i had in the city!
author: Yuan Z.

description: Love this place. However they wont deliver to me even though we are both in the sunset. I don't like that they contract out my order to their other location on Lincoln. I prefer the food at the 9th street location that is why only 4 stars
author: Danielle D.

description:
This is my favorite Thai place. If I'm ever ordering or going for Thai, I go to sriracha. I live a few blocks away and I like it better than Marnee which is another in the area. 

Highly recommend the pad Thai, pad see ew, and green curry. Also amazing spring rolls! It's also super affordable with most entrees under $10. Fast and friendly service too!
author: Kasia G.

description:
Soooo good!
I was walking around looking for dinner and wandered in. 
I got the red curry with tofu.
It was amazing.
A perfect balance of flavors - the veggies were perfectly cooked and their deliciousness shined through even with the flavorful curry. 
Delicious appetizers as well. 
I feel wonderfully full and satisfied. 
Definitely my new thai spot in Sunset.
author: Hardin K.

description:
I came here with a friend on a Sunday evening when every other place nearby had lines out the door. I was rather surprised to find a 4.5 star place with room to spare, so we headed in to try it out.

I have to say, after eating here, I'm absolutely baffled. Everything about the meal was right, and yet we were one of only five tables!

We had the chicken pad sew, the beef pad kee mao, and the duck curry.

The pad sew was fantastic. Great balance of flavours. I had it with the chicken, but I think beef would have been better. The chicken was by no means dry, but it was definitely less moist.

The roasted duck in red coconut curry was delicious. I didn't have much, since I found it a bit spicy, but my friend loved it. I have to disagree with Andrea V., though; we found that we needed an extra order of rice. As for the pad kee mao, the meat ratio was a little low, and I've had better rice noodles. But it was still quite tasty.

The Thai iced tea was good, if a bit sweet. I had never had it before, but I think I would get it again.

The decorations weren't anything to write home about, and the instrumental music playing was light and inoffensive. All in all, Sriracha Thai really deserves its 4.5 star rating, and you'd be amiss not to give it a try.
author: Yves L.

description: Late post here! When we visited this place it was a great experience. The food was awesome and the service was great! The atmosphere was inviting and peaceful.
author: Steph L.

description: This place looks cool on the outside but what are aesthetics worth if the pad thai is overdone and plain and tasteless???
author: Bertha T.

description: I love this stream muscles here so much it's really fresh and the sauce that to eat with it's so good.
author: Waan W.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants to go to. I brought my family here and they really enjoyed the food (they thought they wouldn't like it because Thai is known for their spiciness). Would come here again!
author: Carmen L.

description: They serve up an excellent lunch to go - - - generous lunch portions and excellent tasting food. I love their peanut sauce over chicken & vegetables. Where else can you eat a wholesome and filling lunch founder $8. We used to favor Marnee Thai that is located just up the street but Siracha has proven to be a much better choice.
author: Jim H.

description:
Some background: this spot used to be named "Soi Gow Thai Noodle Cafe". The same man who owns this restaurant also owns "Sri Thai Cuisine" that's located on 48th and Lincoln in the Outer Sunset. In a way, you can say that these two family owned restaurants dominate the Sunset District in terms of Thai food, because both are incredibly tasty and offer quick service at affordable prices.

This specific location had a re-birth if you will. They changed their name to "Sriracha Thai" and remodeled the outside of the restaurant to a more modern look. Though management never changed, they definitely stepped up their game. Before changing their name, they had a 3.5 stars on Yelp, and now sit at 4.5 stars. It's definitely deserving, as they deliver perfectly in all areas: the Red Curry with Chicken here is top notch. Quick tip: one order can feed two people, just make sure to order side rice for each of you. The Satay Chicken is always great, even before their re-branding, this was always my go to appetizer. The peanut sauce is just awesome. Lastly, the Pad Thai. Hard to compare to all the other Thai places I've been to in the past, but I will say that it's as good as any here. 

The one thing they excel at is making high quality Thai food at inexpensive prices. I love that they import their tea from Thailand- something that I asked the woman working here because I was hoping to find out where I can buy the tea myself. Just a short fly away from Thailand! It also is just 1 dollar tea, what a deal considering the lady refilled my tea at least 4 times. They are very attentive here and strive for good service. 

Final verdict: this place is fantastic. Located on a quieter block of the inner Sunset, it's a great place for a night out. The service here is impeccable- food comes out right on time and in the perfect order. Speaking of the food: yum, yum, yum! I have absolutely zero complaints about Sriracha Thai. Definitely a place you need to visit at least once, if not more!
author: Alex B.

description: This is our neighborhood restaurant go to. The food is great. The service is fast. And, best of all, you never have to wait for a table. Also, of course, the prices are fantastic.
author: Madeleine S.

description: I'm leaving this review because I live in the area, love this place, and don't know how a restaurant this solid doesn't get more business. I like it more than other, more popular Thai restaurants in the area. I have a mostly take out relationship with Sriracha Thai, as in I order 2 or 3 entrees at once and then eat them for the next several meals when I don't have time to cook. The Pad Se-Ew is delicious and though I order different dishes, I often come back to and can recommend the Pad Woon Sen and fried rice with crispy chicken, and papaya salad.
author: Susan S.

description:
Walked in at 6:30 on a Sunday evening to place a take out order for 1-- yellow curry with chicken, white rice, and a soda ($15)-- and was asked to sit and wait at the bar. At 7:15, I still hadn't received my order. The waitress then proceeded to shuffle through the receipts, come up short, and ask me what I had ordered. 

40 minutes for a take out order placed in-person.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Sriracha Thai Cuisine.  If the word "sriracha" is part of the name of your restaurant, I better see some innovative Thai dishes with tons of sriracha on it.

-Salmon Rolls- No, not the rolls similar to sushi rolls, sadly.  These were basically fried eggrolls but a thinner version.  Not memorable but the spicy mayo sauce was good
-Pad See Yew- My go to dish whenever I dine at a Thai restaurant.  Good portion, good flavor
-Sriracha Fried Rice (Chef's specialty)- I was expecting flaming red rice but was sort of disappointed.  Regular fried rice dish with shrimps and veggies topped with a runny egg and a dipping sauce on the side which was the sriracha sauce with a bit of sweetness. The sauce was very subtle but luckily the fried rice was good on its own.

Service was good.  Kinda wish the sriracha dish was as hot as my company.
author: Linda N.

description:
Gentle and quiet service
Tasty and not so gentle spicy dishes

Somehow the name Sriracha awoke our tastebuds, and tastebuds were surely awaken! Although a cold rainy weeknight, the restaurant was still pretty busy so we were expecting a bit of a wait but instead food and drinks came out all quite quickly. We ordered the ginger chicken special and the spicy crispy duck and they were both REALLY good. Newbie tip: if something starts to feel spicy, the spiciness will only build up, so remember to pace yourself. 

It was a breath of fresh air from the standard fast thai joints that mostly offer varieties of curry and salads. Our pan fried dishes were solid and the soups around us all looked and smelled amazing. Very glad we decided to try the unassuming spot without the flashy logo outside and can't wait to come back again very soon!
author: Jade T.

description:
Food- 4 starflavorful and good amount. 
 We had corn cakes, panang curry, kana moo krob, duck fried rice, and pad kee mao. Everything was very good. 

Service - great, very accommodating, and attentive.
author: Tiffany L.

description: One of my favorite tai food restaurants in san Francisco. I enjoy the vibe in the place too. The food is just delicious. I love coming here.
author: Cesar G.

description: This is a solid Thai food place with quick service. I wouldn't come here for dinner because I feel that the price is a bit steep for the amount of food you get, but the lunch specials make this place worth coming to for a quick meal. Overall the food was pretty good. The thai curry was a little more on the sweet side, but it was still good.
author: Lynn T.

description: Ordered a #81 Togo, it was delicious I was starving. Under $10, but reasonable portion in inner Sunset. To me the portion are kinda little doesn't fill me up, prob need 1.5x of their current portion. No wait when they just opened, the food came out pretty quick like(5minutes). Will try something new next time.
author: Jasper K.

description:
*nose wrinkle*

ehhh ... I don't even know where to start. I think I must've came on a bad day or something, because I was quite disappointed with my food. Kinda confused and surprised that this restaurant has that high of a rating.

I was meeting up with some of my friends after work (6:30pm on a lovely Tuesday evening). We decided to give this place a try. Located near 9th and Irving and not too far from the muni N stop. On the outside it actually look pretty nice. There was no wait because it was literally empty. I think besides us, there was one or two other groups there (at 6:30pm on a Tuesday night!)

I ordered a Thai Iced Tea and Pad Thai with Beef. My friends ordered a Pad Thai w/ Chicken and the Sriracha fried rice.

I don't know how to say this, but the Pad Thai in general was awful awful. The beef was soggy, chewy, and tasteless. I had to pick the beef out from my dish because I was having a hard time swallowing it. I mean come on, you're making all the cows in the world look bad. You're not doing justice to their delicious meats. Undercooked and bland, it's literally the worst beef I've had in my life. 

Ok, maybe I just had a bad dish. I turned to my right and my friend who ordered the Pad Thai with Chicken - she didn't even touch her dish. She prbly had like one or two bites of it and that was it. The noodles were undercooked, the chicken was dry. It was $9 for a dish so I guess while it's not super expensive, but I definitely expected more for my money's worth. Worst Thai dining experience ever.

final thoughts: nope never coming back here, and I can not in my good conscience recommend this place to anyone. if you're insistent on coming here, then avoid the pad thai like the plague
author: Xin W.

description: Really good ingredients, I prefer their Green Curry over Marnee Thai. Better tasting & cheaper. Super friendly staff, I go here way too often.
author: Tanner M.

description: I like this restaurant a lot. Recently priced nice and friendly easy to get to. I enjoy the yellow curry a lot, the pad thai, the decor. I eat here.
author: Sparky W.

description:
The service here is absolutely fantastic. But granted, my friend and I came in on a Sunday night when it was pouring rain. 

We were seated extremely promptly as the restaurant was pretty empty. Starving hungry, we ended up ordering the fresh spring rolls, pla jien, red curry, pineapple fried rice, and pad thai. Our food came out extremely quickly and boy was it delicious! The pineapple fried rice seems like a popular dish as the person next to us ordered it too, and it has a very distinct sweet and savory taste, which i highly recommend. Also highly suggest the spring rolls as an appetizer. The pla jien, red curry, and pad thai were pretty good, standard for a Thai restaurant, but hands down wins over a majority of Thai places i've had in the greater NorCal area. Their mango and sticky rice is served with fresh mango and is definitely a palette cleanser. 

PS- If you check in on Yelp, you get a free thai iced tea (which was also very delicious!)
author: Jessie W.

description: I live close by and have been meaning to try this place out. To my very pleasant surprise the food is awesome! I had the vegetarian pad thai, which was bursting with flavor. I ordered take out and the food was still piping hot when I got there, and was ready in no time. Wonderful service, and awesome food. Will be back
author: Andrew N.

description: This place is my go to for thai food delivery. Everything always arrives hot and delivery is very fast. My fave dishes are the pineapple fried rice, shrimp pad thai, guay tiew kai kua (get this spicy with shrimp and no bean sprouts. The best noodle dish everrrrr), veggie and tofu green curry (medium spice) and the pad himapan (spicy with fried shrimp). The delivery staff here are always really nice and sweet.
author: Stacey M.

description:
Good food... Happened to be walking past it... Good thing I decided to come in... Was pleasantly surprised. Ordered Tom yum, green curry and pad eggplant with chicken! Everything was served hot and had delicious flavors. Will come back again soon! 
Oh yes and parking right across the street!
author: A K.

description:
The food was tasty, delicious and well balanced - just enough flavor. 
- chicken satay 4/5
-  par Thai 3.5/ 5 too much sauce SN drier!!! With more noodles 
- tom yum noodle soup. 4.5/5. Great flavor!
-  stir fried eggplant and chicken. 5/5 The egg plant was perfectly cooked

Can't wait to return and try more dishes

I've had their pad  see ewe before - could've been drier with less oil. 3.5/ 5.  I like it still. 

So nice to dine in a quiet,  clean and pleasant environment where you can have a decent conversation. Good service and reasonable prices.
author: Doreen F.

description:
Grilled chicken is a bit burned although i asked them to remade already 
Pad thai was dry and not soft, hard to chew. 3/5 for the pad- thai noodle
author: Hien N.

description: I give this place 4 stars because the curry was good and there was no wait on a Sunday night around 7:30. My friend and I were one of the 3 parties there. I got the Panang curry with chicken -- nothing extraordinary and not necessarily better or worse than curry I've had at other Thai restaurants in the sunset district but it satisfied my Thai curry craving!
author: Annie C.

description:
This place was not crowded at all in the middle of the afternoon on a rainy SF weekday. The service is slow. There is sufficient staff but service not to quick. 
We ordered the fried egg rolls for appetizers, they come with peanut sauce and hot sauce. They were OK . We ordered the Pad Thai Noodles with prawns, Pineapple Rice with prawns. and Yellow Curry with chicken. Including Thai Ice Tea the bill came out to about $50.00.
Not bad for 3 people but the food was not that great for Thai food.
First and last time here.

.
author: Dirk D.

description:
Sriracha is a hidden gem a few steps away from Golden Gate Park. After we explored the park, we stumbled upon the last open table in the joint. 

I tend to judge Thai restaurants by their pad see ew and I must saw that I was delightfully surprised by the melange of delicate, nuanced flavors in Sriracha's version. The rice noodles were half the size of the traditional wide rice noodles. The smaller sized noodles were perfectly mixed in with pieces of chicken, eggs, broccoli and carrots.
author: Justyna N.

description:
I'm a fan! I think this place is pretty new and our friend suggested it for dinner. The menu had your typical Thai dishes and service was pretty quick (bonus points for all the water refills!) PS parking here is a PAIN. 

All 4 of us really loved what we ordered and the flavors were so on point! And definitely get the wings as an appetizer my friends were raving about those and I was drooling just looking at them. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu honestly.

I unfortunately ordered a salad (#edcbody) which I was pretty sad about but honestly, it was actually really good! They have a pretty good selection of salads and there was definitely more meat/toppings than actual salad haha. So if you want a lighter/healthier option, this place definitely has them!

All in all, great tasting Thai food but the portions were on the smaller side.
author: Jingxi Z.

description: I've been coming to this place since it was called Soi Gow. I've always enjoyed coming here due to the good food and service. I love places that have lunch specials and rice plates and this place definately has it. Portions are a lil small but still enough to satisfy. It's also usually pretty quiet here so if you're looking to eat by yourself or just have a mellow lunch with a friend this is a great spot!!
author: Carmina D.

description:
Awesome spot secretly hidden in the outer richmond.

Get anything 'penang' style. They accommodated a large reservation on a Saturday evening.
author: Vijay C.

description: Great place for a quiet lunch. The food is good quality, spiciness can be adjusted on most dishes. Service is pretty good, they seem to have a lot of regular guests and do a lot of take out orders as well. I usually order the Pad See Yew made spicy, and it does make me sweat a little. Overall, great option for Thai food in the Inner Sunset.
author: Daryll G.

description: In a very busy area so it can be easy to miss, but glad I gave it a shot! Service here was super friendly and great overall. Ordered the Pad See Ew and that definitely hit the spot!
author: Jimmy S.

description: Came here on a lazy Sunday looking for some dinner. The place was empty which always makes me nervous.  We were sat right away offered drinks and menus quickly.  We ordered spicy chicken wing as an appetizer, sriracha fried rice, green chicken curry and a side of steamed rice.  The wings came out first which I always appreciate.  The were really temperature hot, another bonus.  The skin was crispy with a perfect amount of sauce, the sauce was sweet though not really spicy.  The rest of the food came perfectly timed and was delicious.  The fried rice was full of flavor as was the curry, we both would have preferred it hotter in spice but I forgot to ask for it.  While eating there was a fair amount of people coming in for to go orders which explained the empty dining room. We will definitely be back when in SF
author: Samantha H.

description: I have to be honest, I love this place! Food is great. However, I had an incredibly bad experience that I don't wish upon anyone. My son has allergies, so eating out is a struggle for us. He's allergic to soy (soy sauce, soy bean oil, soy lecithin...etc) , which can be found in a lot of foods. My husband ordered from Sriracha a couple of nights ago and asked for NO SOY. NO SOY PLEASE. When he picked it up the nice lady at the front said "don't worry, I took care of it" so we eat it. Next thing you know, my son is having a full blown reaction, which he hadn't had in almost a year!!! I'm heart broken. He's in pain, the whole family is. I couldn't understand what caused it, until I called Sriracha and asked what oil they used for the fried rice. You can only imagine how I felt when they answered "soy bean oil" even though they had in their computer about our allergies. Again, I love this place. But they've caused us so much pain and they can't take it away. Of course they were apologetic and offered a refund, but nothing can take away the pain they caused my son and my family. Thank you for apologizing,  but please next time take allergens more seriously. My son is ok and he'll get better in a few days, but another family may not be as lucky as us. It's peoples health you are dealing with. I've been told several times we couldn't eat in certain restaurants because they can't promise there's no soy. And I completely understand. I would rather be told that, that what happened.
author: Pia L.

description:
Been here several times over the years, including when they operated under a different name. I don't exactly believe in 3 star reviews, they're meaningless. But that's what this place warrants. Good food, not earth shattering. Being much cheaper would bump it up to 5 stars, not that it's over priced. It's not. Being under priced for the quality and portions would balance things better. Easy for 2 people to come here and spend $40-$60 in order to get full, not including tip. 
Service is good, staff are friendly and the food comes pretty quick.
author: Richard V.

description:
My boyfriend saw this restaurant while we were in the area and decided to have lunch here. 
There was no wait and it's pretty quiet inside. All the outside noises are muted out. 
We ordered the red curry, tum yum soup, and pad Thai. All the dishes were very good and the potions are quite large compared to other Thai restaurants where we live, in the South Bay, and prices are around the same range. I found the curry and pad Thai a bit on the sweeter side but they're both very flavorful. 
The service was great! We didn't have to ask for anything. The waiter gave us plates to share, water refills, and took our empty plates out of the way for more room on the table. 
I'd definitely come back! I wish it was closer to where we live!
author: Catherine L.

description: Pros: Fresh, clean, good food and great presentation. I love the flower made from a straw wrapper . Very attentive. Cons: a bit sweet. Our first time.
author: Carolyne R.

description: I was craving chicken pho but all the Vietnamese places were closed. I ordered the chicken noodle soup with rice noodles and it was great. One point off because I like a saltier broth with more garlic flavor so I doctored it up a bit. Spring rolls were delicious as well and my pick up order was ready super quick. I'll order again!
author: Dana J.

description: Great all around. Everything we ordered was great. Panang curry, Tom Kha soup and mango with sticky rice
author: Amir s.

description: So sad the food was not good. The staff are sweet by maybe not happy. I was very disappointed w the food and will not return here.
author: Gernaut A.

description:
Roasted tender duck in delicious coconut milk curry sauce with no rice but it didn't need it, also included some vegetables (bell peppers )

Thai iced tea made with half and half milk was the perfect combination 

Yum, I am satisfied !
author: Andrea V.

description:
This place changed it's name to used to be called Soi-Gow.  Everything else is the same.  Anyways, my review.  
According to my boyfriend who goes to Thailand a lot, this is by far the most authentic in SF and we've tried several places.  We've been going here for years.  My favorite here is the tom yum, the samosas, and the pineapple fried rice.  They're tea is really good it goes well with many of their dishes and they refill it!  The workers here are attentive and kind.  I can't wait to try their other choices.  Also, Arizmendis and a gelato place is in the same block for desserts after!!!!
author: John P.

description:
This place is awesome. I ordered delivery from Sriracha last night and have nothing but good things to say. The ordering process was simple, the man who delivered my food was very nice and the food itself was still warm and so so good! 

I got the khao soi with chicken, the pad kee mao with tofu and mango sticky rice. Everything tasted really fresh and exceeded my expectations. The only thing that could be improved is the spice level. I ordered medium and found everything a bit mild for my liking.

I've found it surprisingly hard to find good, inexpensive Thai food in the city, so I'm thrilled that I tried this place. 

Highly recommend!
author: Liza B.

description: Loved the tom yam noodle extra spicy. Satisfying on a cold day. I've been looking for a good bowl of tom yam noodle soup for a long time. Many places doing offer it or need to pay extra just for the noodles. I'm  so happy I found it here!
author: Jane A.

description:
I'm in love with this place.  I was craving thai and have passed by this joint numerous times and decided to check it out with my mom.  Service was really great and attentive the second that we walked in.  I ordered the sriracha prawn rice dish which was a pretty big serving, and I absolutely loved that dish!!  My mom ordered some kind of coconut soup (I'm typically not a fan of coconut but I tried a sip of the soup and absolutely loved it!).  Their thai iced tea is the best I've ever had--the perfect blend of sweet and creamy.  Can't wait to go back and try other dishes!  

NOTE: This place is literally right next to the N line, so every 15 minutes or so, you're gonna hear that train rumble on by.  I wasn't too bothered by it, but I can see how some customers may get a little annoyed.  So bear in mind that you'll have a lot of exposure to street noise.  BUT totally worth it for Sriracha's great food!
author: Jackie A.

description: The vibe here is excellent. Great relaxing background music, super sweet/nice service and delicious food! Highly recommend to stop by. I ordered Thai tea with Raad Na and my boyfriend ordered Pad Se-Ew with Thai tea as well. Slurrpp! :)
author: Carolina R.

description: Ate Kanom Jean with crispy pork, pad see yew, woonsen. All tasted good. These entrees are not spicy. I thought the items were tasty and delicious. Parking still hard to find in this neighborhood near Golden Gate Park.
author: Clifford W.

description: Passed by because lots of other restaurants were closed for lunch break. It really surprised me. Ordered Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee, both were excellent. I love Thai food. All dishes we had were delicious. Will definitely come back if I'm going to visit SF again.
author: CiCi H.

description: My wife and I ate there and it was a truly dismal experience.   I like spicy food but she does not.   A Thai friend of ourselves told us to say "no chili and no hot red pepper" rather than mild.   Told the waitress no child and no hot red pepper, and what arrived--hot red pepper on her meal.   Told the waitress who was annoyed, even though she had been told about the hot pepper.   The cook simply washed the meal and put a different sauce on it, so everything was mushy and watery.    I think that the waitress did not really pass on the request to the cook.   Either she was a newbie or just didn't care.  Do not go there if you want a meal that is not overly spiced.
author: Thomas P.

description: Excellent Thai Food delivery.  Much better than I expected.
author: robin m.

description: Very helpful servers. I believe there is a groupon for it that i wish i had before goong in there. Anyhow, nice place and good food yet pricier than expected (not by much)
author: Hugo A.

description:
I love Sriracha!  I have no idea why this place isn't more busy.  It's the best Thai spot in the neighborhood by a mile, in my opinion.  Their food tends to be less greasy/heavy and is more oriented around fresh veggies.

I live nearby, so I eat here regularly and have sampled much of the menu.  The Pad Graw Prow is excellent and it's my go-to.
author: Sean S.

description:
The restaurant service was slow, but the food was very good like the spring roll (vegetarian) and bamboo soup.  The drink I prefer is the Thai ice tea.  We had a senior, adult and two kids, also a Doraemon stuffy and a ty husky stuffy.  The wait wasn't that bad.  The wait for food was worth it.  There was a very clean bathroom and it had mints and tooth picks.  There are no pictures  because I didn't take any pictures.

*submitted by me and my nine year old nephew
author: Ernest S.

description: Excellent service! Delicious food! Srsly one of the best pad thai's I've ever had in the city. Definitely coming back!
author: Paola T.

description: The food gets a 4 star! I grabbed the pad Thai and potstickers with the pesto sauce to-go. I ate it at a near by bar and the food was amazing. I'm sure if I ate the food there at the restaurant, I'd rate it a 5 star. The customer service was great when I gotta walked in. I was greeted and she took my order with a friendly smile. The sauce for the potstickers was soooooo good. I was hesitant to taste pesto on my pot stickers, but it was an amazing. Hands down the best sauce I've had wig any potsticker. The pad Thai wasn't too dry or wet for my taste either. I loved it.
author: Bel O.

description: They have the best curry in the neighborhood (yes, 10x better than Marnee Thai). Service is great, atmosphere is quiet and relaxing. Maybe not as fun for a big group, (unless anyone in your group expects decent curry) and the noodle dishes could use a bit more flavor, but Sriracha Thai delivers much more than expected for the price.
author: Amanda B.

description: Panang Curry looked a bit watery at first, but turned out to be very flavorful and spicy. More creamy than at first appearance. Tasty. The padsew was flavorful, their wok is well seasoned! Good food, we'll come again if we're in the area.
author: Alexander T. G.

description:
Food: ordered the chicken skewers w/peanut sauce as an appetizer, tom kah soup w/prawns & duck curry w/a side of rice - appetizer came out first and entrees followed in timely manner. Every item was flavorful, my first time having duck and it had a chard taste to it, which I absolutely love!! 

Service: me and my boyfriend were seated right away and were given water, always a plus!! server came to take our order as soon as she saw we were ready (restaurant etiquette: close your menus and push them aside). She was on top of water refills, taking dirty dishes away and dropping off the check once we were all stuffed. 

Experience: overall I would definitely come again, I'm not from the city but whenever I'm in the mood for thai food - this will be one of the options.
author: Anastasia A.

description:
The Tom yum soup tastes like tomato soup and the carrots had a perfume taste 
The beef salad beef was very hard and dry, and the cucumber did not tasted fresh
The combo appetizer plate chicken was very hard and dry, spring roll ingredients tasted old and weird, samosa was mushy and not much taste
The pumpkin curry was ok but the chicken was dry
author: Kang C.

description: I came here on a recommendation that someone told me that had some unique items. I ordered the Siracha Fried Rice and the pork belly. Both were very tasty and pretty good sized portions. I like spicy food and I didn't think the fried rice was very spicy even though they said it had a "medium" spice. The service was quick and our food came quick as well. Next time I'll probably go back to my main Thai food spot but it was good to try something new! This place is the same owner as Sri Thai on Lincoln near the beach.
author: Blaine S.

description: New owner recently.  The food and menu seem to be the same.  Price is normal for the area.  Not busy at all during dinner time on weekend.
author: Paul J.

description: Came here for lunch since it was across the street from my chiropractor 's office. 2 stars because the staff was super friendly and accommodating to us and our 14 month old. The food was okay, nothing special. I was hoping for some authentic thai food but the food here is definitely catered for American folks. Everything was super sweet and overly salted. Nothing I would want to come running back for. However if you are looking for a cheap lunch they have great lunch deals.
author: Kaykay M.

description: Liked the quality of all food we ordered. Small and cozy place but food is delicious. Recommend it. (P.S. I have Indian taste-bud).
author: Koly S.

description: It's a great place. Very quiet and peaceful. The food was really good...just don't  come so hungry because it might not fill you up. We requested to watch the soccer game and the ladies were so nice to follow up with our request.  The order came fast too.  Great place to talk with friends and family.
author: Kenia A.

description: Me and my best friend drove through crazy SF in the rain and then walked about 10 minutes to get to this place, and I must say it was well worth it! Wonderful and very fast service, delicious wonderful quality food! Plus when we checked on Yelp we each got a free Thai tea and I absolutely don't like Thai tea, but I could've had 10 of theirs! If you're in the SF area and looking for some excellent Thai cuisine with great service go here!!
author: Kayla W.

description: My mom is Thai so I pretty much grew up with Thai food. This restaurant is one of the best Thai restaurant in San Francisco at least it's the best one in inner sunset area. I usually come here for lunch, prices are reasonable and a lot of varieties as well! My favorites are roasted duck noodles, seafood noodles, garlic basil pork and beef salad etc. give it a try, their food is so much better than lots of Thai restaurants in U.S.
author: Abby Y.

description: I have come here numerous times on my lunch break I work up the street at UCSF. My last experience at this place has left a sour taste in my mouth. Not due to the food but the manner in which the waitress demand my coworkers and I tip her. We all paid with debit card and as we left she yelled we hadn't paid. So we call turned around to the whole restaurant looking at us since she screamed we didn't pay. She then said you didn't pay service fee. I said what is that? She said basically it was her tip and she again demanded we give her a cash tip. I left embarrassed for her and her lack of class. I was late due to here ignoring my request for our bill. She Is a scam artist if that service fee is genuine why wasn't is automatically added to the bill? We were a party of 3 not a huge group. I will NEVER return and I have warned all my coworkers to watch out the are thief's.
author: Dunenka S.

description: I've lived in the Sunset area for the past three years and  never realized that there's a really good Thai food on 9th and Irving. I came here with a bunch of friends for lunch the other day and pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. I love Thai fried rice and their version is definitely one of the best I had. The only disappointment is that they're always out of the tilapia every time. Not sure if the demand for the dish is too low. You can actually find tilapia everywhere easily. Servers wear traditional Thai costume which is cute and add to the originality and the whole atmosphere. I've been going back since especially when I'm in the mood of Thai food.
author: Mariner Z.

description: I love this place. Good portion size, great flavors. The staff is great and remembers their regulars. I've only been here at lunch but even during a busy lunch rush, they still are quick and good food for someone on the go who just doesn't have time for slow service.
author: cindy c.

description: got the lunch special which came with the most delicious soup and generous portions. great service and attention to detail. recommend the yellow curry and the basil chicken stir fry.
author: Button L.

description: So good I'm leaving a review from inside the resturuant! This is the best Thai I've had in the city so far, and by far the best in the Sunset. Their pad see yew is absolutely delicious, and when I asked for extra spice they balanced it perfectly. A lot of places will overcook their shrimp, but mine were cooked perfectly. The service is very fast, I received my food within 15 minutes, but everything tastes so fresh. Definitely my new favorite spot.
author: Solana W.

description: So good! Their pad thai is very sweet, and their massaman curry is to die for!
author: Joey N.

description: Wow!!! I had the pad se-ew and pad gra prow. Both were sooo perfectly seasoned and yummy. Their prices are so good I splurged and got two desserts: fried banana with coconut ice cream and sweet sticky rice with warm mango. I'm a desserts guy and these were delicious. Food arrived quick, which I had hoped for because it is nearby and I was starving so time was of the essence. This was my first time and I will be ordering again!
author: Ryan G.

description:
Visited on a Thursday evening around 8:30. and ordered a dish the menu described as "Fried Rice. Stir-fried rice with egg onion and tomato served with fresh cucumber and tomato." We asked for this dish with prawns and ordered beer to drink.

THE GOOD:  
   Beer: cold
   Service: quick
   Napkins: cloth
THE BAD:
   Fried rice - very greasy, tasted like leftovers.
   Egg:  overcooked and tough
   Tomato: none in the fried rice
    Onion: there was some but was also greasy
   Prawns: burnt black on the outside, overcooked to the extent that most of the prawn flesh was nothing more than a dried coating stuck to the inside of the shell. 
  Cucumber and tomato: measly--  two slices of cucumber and one eighth of a small tomato.

REALLY wanted to love this place, based on the good Yelp reviews. Although the severely overcooked food and greasy fried rice may have been due to the lateness of the hour, that's no justification. 

With many other restaurants in the area, we won't return.
author: Yelp E.

description: Tasty tasty tasty! The food is really good. The service is both polite and excellent. We enjoyed eating here very much. Too bad there isn't one near my house.
author: Shira B.

description: Love this thai place. The red curry with brown rice is my favorite! Quick service and good prices. Definitely recommend!
author: Danielle P.

description:
After buying shoes across the street, my wife and I were looking for a place for lunch, and Sriracha was across the street. They have an extensive lunch menu with combo specials. My wife had the Pad Thai combo and I had the Basil Chicken combo, comes with vegetable lemongrass soup, a samosa, and BBQ chicken. The basil chicken comes with rice as well.
The food was very tasty, very hot, and the dish ordered thai spicy was indeed spicy.
The server was attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back.
author: Scott R.

description: Very nice and attentive service and great food! Have passed by the restaurants a lot and finally went in last week. I specifically loved the fried mango shrimp which was one of the specials of the day. Will definitely be back!
author: Gohar B.

description: nice service, but the food was very bland (difficult to find bland thai) and everything kind of tasted the same... I don't understand why they have 4.5 starts??  I hate to be mean, but I just didn't like any of the dishes.  The servers, as usual at thai restaurants, were very sweet and gentle.
author: Mike N.

description: We have eaten here several times and always have had good food and good, attentive service. Really enjoy their eggplant and mixed veggie dishes. Also the coconut chicken soup is delicious. We will continue to frequent this friendly neighborhood spot.
author: mendy m.

description: Fantastic Thai food.  All of our three dishes were great. Better than what you get in Thailand.
author: Domenic C.

description: Food and Service was bad. Sriracha fried rice was bland, dry, and didn't taste like it had any Sriracha sauce in it. The fried egg on top was also dry. The mango sticky rice was the worst I have ever tasted. The mango itself was good but the rice was not done correctly, they just drizzled some coconut cream on top. Worst ever. Service was awful. I ordered the rice to eat there. After the food came, they never checked back in with me, and I had to wave them down twice to get their attention to bring me my check. Will not be going back to this place especially with better Thai restaurants in the area/city.
author: Dara A.

description: Ordered Tom Yang soup, deepfired pork bely with chinese broccholi and Tofu red curry.  All tasty.  Will come back
author: Pi-Te Jau Hua P.

description: My absolute new favorite Thai place in the sunset. Amazing! And super inexpensive - great value!
author: Jackie G.

description: Awesome!  Perfectly spiced curries in a friendly, well kept setting.  Forget the place up the street.
author: Steve M.

description: The food here is FABULOUS! We tried the salmon rolls, pumpkin curry and a dish where the shrimps were in a mix of vegetables with a red spicy sauce in a shelled out mango. I will definitely return!
author: K E.

description: So good.  We arrived at the right moment because it got packed.  Service was very good too.  Definitely recommend the catfish herbal salad special.  Will come again.
author: Allyson H.
